SectionSubtitle.Text: Trusted by thousands of clients across Manchester

Quote.Text: MCR Solicitors helped my family reunite after years of separation. Their immigration team was professional, caring, and kept us informed every step of the way. I cannot thank them enough.
Going through a divorce was the hardest time of my life, but the team at MCR made it bearable. They fought for fair custody arrangements and always had my children's best interests at heart.
After my workplace accident, I didn't know where to turn. MCR Solicitors took my case on a no win, no fee basis and secured compensation that helped me through my recovery.

Description.Text: Take the first step towards resolving your legal matters. Our friendly team is here to help you understand your options and guide you through the process.

SectionSubtitle.Text: Common questions about our legal services

Answer.Html: Yes, we offer a free initial consultation for all new clients. This allows us to understand your situation and advise on the best course of action with no obligation.
Our fees vary depending on the complexity of your case. We offer fixed fee options for many services and transparent pricing. For personal injury cases, we work on a no win, no fee basis.

Question.Text: How long will my case take?

Answer.Html: The duration depends on the type and complexity of your case. Immigration applications can take 3-12 months, family law matters vary greatly, and personal injury claims typically take 6-18 months. We'll provide a realistic timeline during your consultation.
Yes, we can arrange home visits for clients who are unable to travel to our office. We also offer video consultations via Zoom or Teams for your convenience.

MetaTitle.Text: Immigration Solicitors Manchester | UK Visa & Asylum Lawyers | MCR Solicitors

MetaDescription.Text: Expert immigration solicitors in Manchester. Specialist advice on UK visas, asylum claims, citizenship, family reunification. SRA regulated. Free consultation.

MetaKeywords.Text: immigration solicitors manchester, uk visa lawyers, asylum solicitors, citizenship application

Subtitle.Text: Expert guidance through the UK immigration system

HtmlBodyPart.Html:
Trusted Immigration Solicitors in Manchester

Navigating the UK immigration system can be complex and stressful. At MCR Solicitors, our dedicated immigration team has over 20 years of experience helping individuals and families achieve their immigration goals.

Whether you're applying for a visa, seeking asylum, or wanting to bring your family to the UK, we provide expert legal advice tailored to your unique situation. We understand the life-changing nature of immigration decisions and are committed to achieving the best possible outcome for you.

Free Consultation

Speak to an immigration specialist today

Book Now

SectionSubtitle.Text: Comprehensive immigration support for all your needs

Description.Text: Work visas, student visas, skilled worker visas, and visitor visas. We guide you through every step of the application process.
Compassionate support for those seeking protection in the UK. We help you present your case effectively.
Spouse visas, fiancÃ© visas, and family member applications to bring your loved ones to the UK.
British citizenship applications and indefinite leave to remain. Start your journey to becoming a British citizen.
Immigration appeals, judicial reviews, and challenging Home Office decisions.
Sponsor licences, innovator visas, and supporting businesses with their immigration needs.

Question.Text: How long does a UK visa application take?

Answer.Html: Processing times vary depending on the visa type. Standard applications typically take 3-8 weeks, while priority services can reduce this to 5 working days. We'll provide you with a realistic timeline based on your specific circumstances.

Question.Text: What documents do I need for an immigration application?

Answer.Html: Required documents vary by visa type but typically include: valid passport, proof of finances, English language evidence, accommodation details, and supporting documents specific to your application. We'll provide a comprehensive checklist tailored to your case.

Question.Text: Can I appeal a refused visa application?

Answer.Html: Many visa refusals can be appealed or challenged through administrative review or judicial review. The options available depend on the visa type and grounds for refusal. We specialise in immigration appeals and have a strong success rate.

Question.Text: Do you offer Legal Aid for immigration cases?

Answer.Html: Legal Aid is available for certain immigration cases, particularly asylum claims and some immigration detention cases. We can assess your eligibility during your free consultation and explore all funding options available to you.

Title.Text: Speak to Our Immigration Team Today

Description.Text: Get expert guidance on your immigration matter. Our multilingual team speaks Urdu, Punjabi, Hindi, and Arabic.

MetaTitle.Text: Family Law Solicitors Manchester | Divorce & Child Custody Lawyers | MCR Solicitors

MetaKeywords.Text: family law solicitors manchester, divorce lawyers, child custody solicitors, financial settlement

Subtitle.Text: Compassionate legal support for family matters

HtmlBodyPart.Html:
Sensitive Family Law Support in Manchester

Family legal matters are among the most emotionally challenging situations you may face. At MCR Solicitors, we provide compassionate, professional support to help you navigate these difficult times.

Our experienced family law team understands that every family is unique. We take the time to understand your situation and work with you to find solutions that protect your interests and, where children are involved, prioritise their welfare.

Confidential Consultation

Discuss your family matter in confidence

Book Now

SectionSubtitle.Text: Comprehensive support for all family matters

Description.Text: Expert guidance through the divorce process, including no-fault divorce applications and separation agreements.
Helping parents reach agreements on where children will live and spend time with each parent.
Fair division of assets, pensions, and financial arrangements following relationship breakdown.
Emergency injunctions, non-molestation orders, and support for victims of domestic abuse.
Protecting your assets before marriage with legally sound pre-nuptial agreements.
Advice on child maintenance arrangements and representing you in disputes.

SectionSubtitle.Text: Common questions about family legal matters

Question.Text: How long does a divorce take?

Answer.Html: Under the new no-fault divorce system, the minimum timeframe is 26 weeks from application to final order. The financial settlement may take longer depending on complexity and whether agreement can be reached.

Question.Text: How is property divided in a divorce?

Answer.Html: The court aims for a fair division, considering factors like the length of marriage, contributions, needs, and earning capacity. This doesn't always mean 50/50. We'll advise you on what's likely in your situation.

Question.Text: Can I get help with domestic abuse urgently?

Answer.Html: Yes. We can apply for emergency non-molestation orders and occupation orders on the same day if necessary. Your safety is our priority. Call us immediately if you're in danger.

Question.Text: What are my rights regarding seeing my children?

Answer.Html: Both parents generally have the right to be involved in their children's lives. If you can't agree arrangements with the other parent, we can help through mediation or court applications.

Title.Text: Speak to Our Family Law Team

Description.Text: Get confidential, compassionate support for your family matter. We're here to help you through this difficult time.

MetaTitle.Text: Personal Injury Solicitors Manchester | No Win No Fee Claims | MCR Solicitors

MetaDescription.Text: Expert personal injury solicitors in Manchester. No win, no fee accident claims, workplace injuries, medical negligence. Free case assessment available.

MetaKeywords.Text: personal injury solicitors manchester, no win no fee, accident claims, workplace injury compensation

Subtitle.Text: No Win, No Fee - Get the compensation you deserve

HtmlBodyPart.Html:
Expert Personal Injury Solicitors in Manchester

If you've been injured through no fault of your own, you deserve compensation. At MCR Solicitors, we work on a No Win, No Fee basis, meaning you pay nothing unless we win your case.

Our experienced personal injury team has helped thousands of clients receive fair compensation for their injuries. We understand the physical, emotional, and financial impact an injury can have on your life, and we're committed to fighting for the maximum compensation you're entitled to.

No Win, No Fee

Start your claim with zero financial risk

Free Assessment

SectionSubtitle.Text: Expert representation for all personal injury matters

Description.Text: Claims for injuries from car accidents, motorcycle crashes, and pedestrian incidents. We handle whiplash, serious injuries, and fatalities.
Accidents at work, industrial diseases, and employer negligence claims. Your employer has a duty of care.
Claims against hospitals, doctors, and healthcare providers for substandard care that caused harm.
Public liability claims for injuries in shops, restaurants, public places, and private property.
Compensation for victims of violent crime through the Criminal Injuries Compensation Authority (CICA).
Claims for injuries sustained during sports activities where negligence is involved.

SectionTitle.Text: Why Choose MCR Solicitors for Your Claim?

Description.Text: You only pay if we win your case. No hidden costs or upfront fees.
We fight for every penny you're entitled to, including future losses.
We work with leading medical experts to support your claim.
Where possible, we secure early payments to help with immediate expenses.

Question.Text: How much is my claim worth?

Answer.Html: Compensation depends on the severity of your injury, financial losses, and impact on your life. We'll give you an honest assessment during your free consultation based on similar cases.

Question.Text: How long do I have to make a claim?

Answer.Html: Generally, you have 3 years from the date of the accident or from when you became aware of your injury. Claims involving children have different rules. Contact us as soon as possible to avoid missing deadlines.

Question.Text: What if the accident was partly my fault?

Answer.Html: You may still be able to claim compensation. The amount may be reduced to reflect your share of responsibility (contributory negligence), but you won't be left empty-handed.

Question.Text: How long will my claim take?

Answer.Html: Simple claims can settle in 6-12 months. Complex cases involving serious injuries may take longer. We always work to resolve your claim as quickly as possible while maximising your compensation.

Title.Text: Start Your No Win, No Fee Claim Today

Description.Text: Get a free, no-obligation assessment of your claim. We'll tell you honestly if you have a case and what it's worth.

MetaTitle.Text: UK Family Visas | Spouse, Partner & Family Reunion Visas | MCR Solicitors

Subtitle.Text: Reunite with your loved ones in the UK

HtmlBodyPart.Html:
Family Visa Services

Bringing families together is at the heart of what we do. Our experienced immigration solicitors have helped thousands of families reunite in the UK.

Types of Family Visas We Handle

  • Spouse Visa - For married partners of British citizens or settled persons
  • Unmarried Partner Visa - For couples in long-term relationships
  • FiancÃ©(e) Visa - For those planning to marry in the UK
  • Parent Visa - For parents of children settled in the UK
  • Child Visa - For children of settled persons
  • Adult Dependent Relative Visa - For elderly or dependent relatives

Financial Requirements

Family visa applications have specific financial requirements including a minimum income threshold of Â£29,000 (increasing to Â£38,700 in 2025). We'll help you understand and meet these requirements.

Why Choose Us?

With over 20 years of experience in family immigration, we understand the emotional nature of these cases. We provide compassionate, expert guidance throughout the process.

Free Assessment

Get a free eligibility assessment for your family visa application.

Contact Us Today

MetaTitle.Text: UK Work Visas | Skilled Worker & Sponsored Visas | MCR Solicitors

Subtitle.Text: Build your career in the United Kingdom

HtmlBodyPart.Html:
UK Work Visa Services

Looking to work in the UK? Our specialist immigration team can help you navigate the UK's work visa system and secure the right visa for your circumstances.

Types of Work Visas

  • Skilled Worker Visa - For those with a job offer from a UK employer with a sponsor licence
  • Health & Care Worker Visa - For qualified healthcare professionals
  • Global Talent Visa - For leaders and potential leaders in academia, arts, or digital technology
  • Intra-Company Transfer - For employees transferring to a UK branch
  • Scale-up Visa - For skilled workers joining fast-growing UK businesses

Requirements

Work visa applications require a Certificate of Sponsorship from a licensed employer, meeting salary thresholds, and demonstrating English language proficiency. We'll guide you through each requirement.

Employer Sponsorship

We also help employers obtain sponsor licences to hire international workers.

Learn More

Our Business Immigration Services

MetaTitle.Text: UK Visitor Visas | Standard & Family Visitor Visas | MCR Solicitors

MetaDescription.Text: UK visitor visa assistance. Standard visitor visas, family visit visas, business visitor visas. Manchester immigration solicitors.

MetaKeywords.Text: uk visitor visa, standard visitor visa, family visit visa uk, tourist visa uk

Subtitle.Text: Visit family, tourism, or business in the UK

HtmlBodyPart.Html:
UK Visitor Visa Services

Planning a visit to the UK? Whether for tourism, visiting family, or business meetings, we can help you obtain the right visitor visa.

Visitor Visa Types

  • Standard Visitor Visa - For tourism, visiting family, or business activities
  • Marriage Visitor Visa - For those coming to marry in the UK
  • Medical Treatment Visa - For private medical treatment in the UK
  • Parent of a Child at School Visa - For parents visiting children studying in the UK

Duration & Conditions

Standard visitor visas allow stays of up to 6 months. You cannot work, access public funds, or study for more than 30 days. We'll ensure you understand all conditions and maximize your chances of approval.

Refused Before?

If you've had a previous visa refused, we can help you understand the reasons and prepare a stronger application.

Long-Term Visit Visa

Regular visitors may qualify for a 2, 5, or 10-year visit visa.

Ask Us How

Title.Text: Get Your Visitor Visa Application Right

Description.Text: Expert help to ensure your visitor visa application succeeds.

MetaTitle.Text: Indefinite Leave to Remain (ILR) | Settled Status UK | MCR Solicitors

MetaDescription.Text: ILR and settled status applications. Permanent residence in the UK. Expert immigration solicitors in Manchester.

MetaKeywords.Text: indefinite leave to remain, ilr uk, settled status, permanent residence uk

Subtitle.Text: Settle permanently in the United Kingdom

HtmlBodyPart.Html:
Indefinite Leave to Remain (ILR) Services

ILR, also known as settled status, allows you to live and work in the UK permanently without immigration restrictions. It's an important step toward British citizenship.

Routes to ILR

  • 5-Year Route - After 5 years on most work or family visas
  • Family Route - After 5 years on a spouse/partner visa
  • 10-Year Long Residence - After 10 years of lawful continuous residence
  • Private Life - Based on long residence and private life in the UK

Requirements

ILR applications require demonstrating continuous residence, passing the Life in the UK test, meeting English language requirements, and showing no serious criminal convictions. We'll help you prepare a complete application.

After ILR

Once you have ILR, you can apply for British citizenship after 12 months. We can guide you through that process too.

Don't Lose Your Status

ILR can lapse if you're outside the UK for more than 2 years. Speak to us about protecting your status.

Get Advice

Subtitle.Text: Ready to Settle in the UK?

Description.Text: Our experts will ensure your ILR application is prepared to the highest standard.

MetaTitle.Text: British Citizenship & Naturalisation | Passport Applications | MCR Solicitors

MetaDescription.Text: British citizenship and naturalisation applications. Expert help with UK passport applications. Manchester immigration solicitors.

MetaKeywords.Text: british citizenship, naturalisation uk, uk passport application, become british citizen

HtmlBodyPart.Html:
British Citizenship Services

Becoming a British citizen is a significant milestone. It gives you the right to live and work in the UK permanently, vote in elections, and hold a British passport.

Ways to Become British

  • Naturalisation - For adults with ILR or settled status
  • Marriage to British Citizen - Reduced residency requirements
  • Registration - For children and certain other categories
  • Descent - Through British parents or grandparents

Requirements for Naturalisation

You must have held ILR for at least 12 months, meet residency requirements, be of good character, pass the Life in the UK test, and meet English language requirements.

Citizenship Ceremony

Once approved, you'll attend a citizenship ceremony to take the oath of allegiance. We'll guide you through what to expect.

Dual Nationality

The UK allows dual citizenship. You don't have to give up your current nationality.

Learn More

Description.Text: Expert guidance on British citizenship and naturalisation applications.

MetaTitle.Text: UK Student Visas | Study in the UK | MCR Solicitors

MetaDescription.Text: UK student visa applications. Study at British universities and colleges. Expert immigration solicitors in Manchester.

MetaKeywords.Text: student visa uk, study in uk, tier 4 visa, university visa uk

HtmlBodyPart.Html:
UK Student Visa Services

The UK is home to some of the world's best universities and colleges. We help students from around the world achieve their educational dreams.

Student Visa Types

  • Student Visa - For courses at degree level and above
  • Child Student Visa - For children aged 4-17 at independent schools
  • Short-term Study Visa - For short courses up to 11 months

Requirements

You'll need a Confirmation of Acceptance for Studies (CAS) from a licensed sponsor, proof of funds, English language evidence, and a valid passport. We'll help you gather all required documents.

Working While Studying

Student visa holders can work part-time during term and full-time during holidays. After completing your degree, you may be eligible for a Graduate visa to stay and work for 2-3 years.

Graduate Route

Completed your studies? The Graduate visa lets you stay and work for 2-3 years.

Find Out More

Subtitle.Text: Planning to Study in the UK?

Description.Text: Start your UK education journey with confidence.

MetaTitle.Text: Immigration Applications | Appeals & Complex Cases | MCR Solicitors

MetaKeywords.Text: immigration appeals, judicial review, immigration detention, complex immigration cases

Subtitle.Text: Complex cases, appeals, and specialist applications

HtmlBodyPart.Html:
Specialist Immigration Services

Not every immigration case fits neatly into standard categories. Our experienced team handles complex and challenging cases that require specialist expertise.

Our Specialist Services

  • Immigration Appeals - Challenging Home Office decisions at tribunal
  • Judicial Review - Challenging unlawful decisions in the High Court
  • Asylum Claims - Protection for those fleeing persecution
  • Human Rights Claims - Article 8 and private/family life claims
  • Immigration Bail - Release from immigration detention
  • Administrative Review - Challenging errors in decisions

Refused Applications

If your application has been refused, don't give up. Many decisions can be successfully challenged. We'll assess your case and advise on the best way forward.

Legal Aid Available

Legal Aid may be available for asylum, detention, and some appeal cases.

Check Eligibility

Description.Text: Our specialist team handles the most challenging immigration cases.

MetaTitle.Text: Divorce Solicitors Manchester | No-Fault Divorce | MCR Solicitors

MetaDescription.Text: Expert divorce solicitors in Manchester. No-fault divorce, contested divorce, quick and affordable divorce proceedings. Free consultation.

MetaKeywords.Text: divorce solicitors manchester, no fault divorce, divorce lawyers, divorce proceedings

HtmlBodyPart.Html:
Divorce Solicitors in Manchester

Going through a divorce is never easy. Our compassionate family law team provides expert guidance and support throughout the entire process.

No-Fault Divorce

Since April 2022, England and Wales have introduced no-fault divorce. This means you no longer need to prove fault or wait years to divorce. The process is simpler and less confrontational.

Our Divorce Services

  • Divorce petition preparation and filing
  • Joint and sole divorce applications
  • Contested divorce proceedings
  • International and overseas divorces
  • Civil partnership dissolution

Timeline

A no-fault divorce typically takes around 6 months from application to final order. We'll keep you informed at every stage.

Fixed Fee Divorces

We offer fixed fee divorce services so you know exactly what you'll pay.

Get a Quote

Title.Text: Speak to Our Family Law Team

Description.Text: Confidential, compassionate advice on your divorce options.

MetaTitle.Text: Judicial Separation Solicitors | Legal Separation UK | MCR Solicitors

MetaDescription.Text: Expert advice on judicial separation. Alternative to divorce while remaining legally married. Manchester family law solicitors.

MetaKeywords.Text: judicial separation, legal separation uk, separation order, separation solicitors

Subtitle.Text: Legal separation without ending your marriage

HtmlBodyPart.Html:
Judicial Separation Services

Judicial separation provides a formal legal recognition that you and your spouse are living apart, without ending the marriage entirely.

Why Choose Judicial Separation?

  • Religious Reasons - For those whose faith doesn't permit divorce
  • Not Yet Married One Year - You must be married at least one year to divorce
  • Uncertainty - When you're not sure if you want to divorce permanently
  • Protection - To protect assets and formalise separation

What Judicial Separation Covers

A judicial separation order allows the court to make orders about finances and property, similar to divorce. However, you remain legally married and cannot remarry.

Financial Orders

The court can make the same financial orders as in divorce proceedings, including orders about property, maintenance, and pensions.

Thinking Long-Term?

You can convert a judicial separation to divorce later if you choose.

Discuss Options

Description.Text: Expert advice on judicial separation and your rights.

MetaTitle.Text: Divorce Financial Settlements | Asset Division | MCR Solicitors

MetaDescription.Text: Expert divorce financial settlement advice. Fair division of assets, property, pensions, and maintenance. Manchester family solicitors.

MetaKeywords.Text: divorce financial settlement, asset division divorce, financial order, ancillary relief

Subtitle.Text: Protecting your financial future after divorce

HtmlBodyPart.Html:
Financial Settlement Services

Dividing finances during divorce can be complex. We help ensure you receive a fair settlement that protects your future financial security.

What's Included in Financial Settlements?

  • Property - The family home and other properties
  • Savings & Investments - Bank accounts, ISAs, shares
  • Pensions - Often the most valuable asset after property
  • Business Assets - Company shares and business interests
  • Maintenance - Spousal and child maintenance payments

Reaching Agreement

We encourage negotiation and mediation where possible. However, if agreement can't be reached, we have extensive court experience to fight for your interests.

Consent Orders

Any financial agreement should be made legally binding through a Consent Order approved by the court. This protects both parties for the future.

Protect Your Assets

Acting quickly is important. Get advice before agreeing to anything.

Get Advice Now

Description.Text: We'll help you understand your entitlements and fight for a fair settlement.

MetaTitle.Text: Child Arrangement Orders | Custody & Access | MCR Solicitors

MetaDescription.Text: Expert child custody and access solicitors. Child arrangement orders, contact disputes, relocation cases. Manchester family lawyers.

MetaKeywords.Text: child arrangement order, child custody solicitors, contact order, custody lawyers

Subtitle.Text: Putting your children's best interests first

HtmlBodyPart.Html:
Child Arrangement Order Services

When parents separate, making arrangements for children can be challenging. We help families reach agreements that work for everyone, especially the children.

What Are Child Arrangement Orders?

Child Arrangement Orders (formerly residence and contact orders) set out who a child lives with and when they spend time with each parent. They're legally binding court orders.

What We Cover

  • Living Arrangements - Where the child will live
  • Contact Time - When the child sees the other parent
  • Holiday Arrangements - Sharing school holidays and special occasions
  • Relocation - Moving with children domestically or abroad
  • Specific Issues - Education, religion, medical treatment

Mediation First

Before applying to court, you usually need to attempt mediation (unless there's domestic abuse). We can help you through both processes.

Child's Best Interests

The court's primary concern is always the welfare of the child.

Get Help Today

Title.Text: Get Expert Advice on Child Arrangements

Description.Text: Compassionate support to help you and your children through this difficult time.

MetaTitle.Text: Non-Molestation Orders | Domestic Abuse Protection | MCR Solicitors

MetaDescription.Text: Emergency protection from domestic abuse. Non-molestation orders, occupation orders, restraining orders. Manchester family solicitors.

MetaKeywords.Text: non molestation order, occupation order, domestic abuse solicitors, restraining order

HtmlBodyPart.Html:
Protection From Domestic Abuse

If you or your children are experiencing domestic abuse, we can help you get urgent legal protection. Your safety is our priority.

Non-Molestation Orders

A non-molestation order is a court order that prohibits someone from molesting, harassing, or threatening you or your children. Breaching the order is a criminal offence.

Occupation Orders

An occupation order regulates who can live in the family home. It can require someone to leave the home and not return, even if they own or rent it.

Emergency Protection

In urgent cases, we can apply for orders without notice to the other party. This means protection can be granted the same day.

Legal Aid Available

Legal Aid is available for domestic abuse cases. You may qualify for free legal help to protect yourself and your children.

In Immediate Danger? Call the police on 999 or the National Domestic Abuse Helpline on 0808 2000 247.

Urgent Help

We offer same-day appointments for domestic abuse cases.

Call Now: 0161 466 1280

Description.Text: We can apply for emergency protection orders to keep you safe.

MetaTitle.Text: Prenuptial Agreements | Pre-Marriage Contracts | MCR Solicitors

MetaDescription.Text: Expert prenuptial agreement solicitors. Protect your assets before marriage. Postnuptial agreements also available. Manchester family lawyers.

MetaKeywords.Text: prenuptial agreement, prenup solicitors, pre marriage contract, postnuptial agreement

HtmlBodyPart.Html:
Prenuptial Agreement Services

A prenuptial agreement allows couples to agree in advance how their assets will be divided if the marriage ends. It's a practical way to protect your interests.

Why Consider a Prenup?

  • Property Ownership - Protect assets you're bringing into the marriage
  • Business Interests - Keep your business separate
  • Inheritance - Protect family wealth for future generations
  • Children from Previous Relationships - Ensure their interests are protected
  • International Families - Clarity when you have assets in multiple countries

Are Prenups Enforceable?

While not automatically binding in England and Wales, prenuptial agreements are given significant weight by courts if properly drafted. Both parties need independent legal advice and full financial disclosure.

Postnuptial Agreements

Already married? It's not too late. We also prepare postnuptial agreements for couples who want to formalize financial arrangements after marriage.

Allow Enough Time

Prenups should be signed at least 28 days before the wedding.

Plan Ahead

Title.Text: Protect Your Future with a Prenup

Description.Text: Confidential advice on prenuptial agreements.

MetaTitle.Text: Road Traffic Accident Claims | Car Accident Solicitors | MCR Solicitors

MetaDescription.Text: Expert road traffic accident claim solicitors. No win no fee. Car, motorcycle, pedestrian accidents. Manchester personal injury lawyers.

MetaKeywords.Text: road traffic accident claim, car accident solicitors, rta claim, accident compensation

HtmlBodyPart.Html:
Road Traffic Accident Claim Services

Been injured in a road traffic accident that wasn't your fault? Our experienced personal injury team can help you claim the compensation you deserve.

Types of RTA Claims We Handle

  • Car Accidents - As a driver or passenger
  • Motorcycle Accidents - Often resulting in serious injuries
  • Cycling Accidents - Collisions involving cyclists
  • Pedestrian Accidents - Hit by a vehicle
  • Public Transport Accidents - Bus, taxi, or coach incidents

What You Can Claim

Compensation may include payment for your injuries, loss of earnings, medical expenses, vehicle damage, travel costs, and care costs if you needed help at home.

No Win No Fee

We handle all RTA claims on a No Win No Fee basis. If we don't win your case, you don't pay our legal fees.

Time Limits Apply

You have 3 years from the accident to make a claim. Don't delay.

Start Your Claim

Description.Text: No Win No Fee. Free initial consultation. We'll fight for maximum compensation.

MetaTitle.Text: Accident at Work Claims | Workplace Injury Solicitors | MCR Solicitors

MetaDescription.Text: Expert workplace accident claim solicitors. No win no fee. Industrial injuries, construction accidents. Manchester personal injury lawyers.

MetaKeywords.Text: accident at work claim, workplace injury solicitors, industrial accident, work compensation

Subtitle.Text: Injured at work? We can help

HtmlBodyPart.Html:
Accident at Work Claim Services

Employers have a legal duty to keep you safe at work. If you've been injured due to their negligence, you may be entitled to compensation.

Types of Workplace Accidents

  • Construction Accidents - Falls, struck by objects, equipment failures
  • Factory & Industrial Injuries - Machinery accidents, exposure to hazards
  • Manual Handling Injuries - Lifting, carrying, repetitive strain
  • Slips, Trips & Falls - Due to unsafe premises
  • Industrial Diseases - Asbestos, noise-induced hearing loss

Your Rights

You're legally protected from dismissal or unfair treatment for making a genuine workplace injury claim. We'll advise you on protecting your employment rights.

No Win No Fee

We handle all workplace accident claims on a No Win No Fee basis, so there's no financial risk to you.

Report the Accident

Make sure your accident is recorded in the workplace accident book.

Get Advice

Description.Text: No Win No Fee. Your job is protected. Get the compensation you deserve.

MetaTitle.Text: Whiplash Injury Claims | Neck Injury Compensation | MCR Solicitors

MetaDescription.Text: Expert whiplash injury claim solicitors. No win no fee. Neck and back injuries from car accidents. Manchester personal injury lawyers.

MetaKeywords.Text: whiplash claim, neck injury compensation, whiplash solicitors, car accident neck injury

Subtitle.Text: Expert help with whiplash compensation claims

HtmlBodyPart.Html:
Whiplash Injury Claim Services

Whiplash is one of the most common injuries from road traffic accidents. Even minor collisions can cause significant neck and back problems.

Understanding Whiplash

Whiplash occurs when your head is suddenly jerked forwards, backwards, or sideways. This can damage the soft tissues in your neck and upper back, causing pain, stiffness, and other symptoms.

Symptoms of Whiplash

  • Neck pain and stiffness
  • Headaches
  • Shoulder and back pain
  • Arm pain or numbness
  • Dizziness
  • Fatigue and difficulty concentrating

Recent Changes to Whiplash Claims

The Whiplash Reforms of 2021 introduced a tariff system for compensation. We navigate these new rules to ensure you receive the maximum amount you're entitled to.

See a Doctor

Get medical attention even for mild symptoms. This creates important evidence for your claim.

Start Your Claim

Title.Text: Get Expert Help with Your Claim

Description.Text: No Win No Fee. We handle all the paperwork while you focus on recovery.

MetaTitle.Text: Medical Negligence Claims | Clinical Negligence Solicitors | MCR Solicitors

MetaDescription.Text: Expert medical negligence solicitors. NHS and private healthcare claims. Misdiagnosis, surgical errors, birth injuries. Manchester clinical negligence lawyers.

MetaKeywords.Text: medical negligence claim, clinical negligence solicitors, nhs negligence, medical malpractice

HtmlBodyPart.Html:
Medical Negligence Claim Services

When medical professionals fail in their duty of care, the consequences can be devastating. We help victims of medical negligence get justice and compensation.

Types of Medical Negligence

  • Misdiagnosis - Delayed, wrong, or missed diagnosis
  • Surgical Errors - Mistakes during operations
  • Birth Injuries - Harm to mother or baby during childbirth
  • Medication Errors - Wrong drug or dosage prescribed
  • Hospital Acquired Infections - MRSA, C. diff, and other infections
  • Dental Negligence - Substandard dental treatment

Proving Negligence

We need to show that the healthcare provider breached their duty of care and that this caused your injury. Medical experts will review your case to establish negligence.

NHS & Private Claims

We handle claims against the NHS, private hospitals, GPs, dentists, and all healthcare providers.

Get Your Records

You're entitled to copies of your medical records. We'll help you obtain them.

Start Your Claim

Description.Text: Specialist medical negligence solicitors. No Win No Fee available.

MetaTitle.Text: Slips, Trips & Falls Claims | Public Liability Solicitors | MCR Solicitors

MetaDescription.Text: Expert slip, trip and fall claim solicitors. Public liability claims. Accidents in shops, pavements, workplaces. Manchester personal injury lawyers.

MetaKeywords.Text: slip trip fall claim, public liability claim, accident in shop, pavement accident

HtmlBodyPart.Html:
Slips, Trips & Falls Claim Services

Property owners and occupiers have a duty to keep their premises safe. If you've been injured due to unsafe conditions, you may be entitled to compensation.

Common Causes of Slips, Trips & Falls

  • Wet Floors - Spills, leaks, or inadequate cleaning
  • Uneven Surfaces - Damaged pavements, potholes, loose paving
  • Poor Lighting - Unable to see hazards
  • Obstacles - Items left in walkways
  • Stairs & Steps - Broken steps, missing handrails
  • Ice & Snow - Failure to grit or clear walkways

Where Do Accidents Happen?

We handle claims for accidents in shops, supermarkets, restaurants, workplaces, public buildings, pavements, car parks, and anywhere else you're lawfully present.

Evidence Matters

Take photos of the hazard and your injuries if possible. Report the accident and get witness details. This evidence can be crucial to your claim.

Report the Accident

Make sure the accident is recorded. Ask for a copy of any incident report.

Get Free Advice

Subtitle.Text: Had a Slip, Trip or Fall?

Description.Text: No Win No Fee. We'll investigate and fight for maximum compensation.

Book Your Free Consultation

Take the first step towards resolving your legal matter. Our experienced solicitors offer free initial consultations to understand your situation and advise on your options.

Consultation Options

  • In-Person - Visit our Manchester office
  • Video Call - Zoom or Teams meeting
  • Phone Consultation - We'll call you at your preferred time
  • Home Visit - Available for those unable to travel

What to Expect

During your consultation, we'll listen to your situation, explain your legal options, discuss likely costs and timescales, and answer any questions you have. There's no obligation to proceed.

Opening Hours

Monday - Friday: 9:00 AM - 5:30 PM
Saturday: 10:00 AM - 2:00 PM (by appointment)
Sunday: Closed

Request an Appointment

Fill in the form and we'll contact you within 24 hours to confirm your appointment.
